page.title: 13THE SCHOOL CONSERVATION AREA
page.content: The conservation area was started Feb 1984.Shrubs were planted to attract nature.Soon after we had a drought the effects of which were not too bad but some of the pond plants died even though the ponds did not dry out. Bradwell Village school was chosen because the site already had some wild plants in it and was some way away from the school.The children from the school all helped to make it by digging the ponds and helping to preserve the plants there.The area was very successful.One amazing feature was the butterfly population though with the bad weather of 1985 it has gone down.The ponds attracted animals including hedgehogs,beetles and dragon flys.The crested newt was introduced to the first pond to help prevent extinction of this species.The area is used as part of the school curriculum.
